1.text: Job also added, taking up his parable, and said:

2.text: Who will grant me, that I might be according to the months past, according to the days in which God kept me?

3.text: When his lamp shined over my head, and I walked by his light in darkness?

4.text: As I was in the days of my youth, when God was secretly in my tabernacle?

5.text: When the Almighty was with me: and my servants round about me?

6.text: When I washed my feet with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil?

7.text: When I went out to the gate of the city, and in the street they prepared me a chair?

8.text: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the old men rose up and stood.

9.text: The princes ceased to speak, and laid the finger on their mouth.

10.text: The rulers held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to their throat.

11.text: The ear that heard me blessed me, and the eye that saw me gave witness to me:

12.text: Because I had delivered the poor man that cried out; and the fatherless that had no helper.

13.text: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me, and I comforted the heart of the widow.

14.text: I was clad with justice: and I clothed myself with my judgment, as with a robe and a diadem.

15.text: I was an eye to the blind, and a foot to the lame.

16.text: I was the father of the poor: and the cause which I knew not, I searched out most diligently.

17.text: I broke the jaws of the wicked man, and out of his teeth I took away the prey.

18.text: And I said: I shall die in my nest, and as a palm tree shall multiply my days.

19.text: My root is opened beside the waters, and dew shall continue in my harvest.

20.text: My glory shall always be renewed, and my bow in my hand shall be repaired.

21.text: They that heard me, waited for my sentence, and being attentive held their peace at my counsel.

22.text: To my words they durst add nothing, and my speech dropped upon them.

23.text: They waited for me as for rain, and they opened their mouth as for a latter shower.

24.text: If at any time I laughed on them, they believed not, and the light of my countenance fell not on earth.

25.text: If I had a mind to go to them, I sat first, and when I sat as a king, with his army standing about him, yet I was a comforter of them that mourned.
